member.name: M:Dalamud.Console.ConsoleManager.GetCommandParsingRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
("[^"]+"|[^\\s"]+)
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions, atomically.
○ Match a sequence of expressions.
○ Match '"'.
○ Match a character other than '"' atomically at least once.
○ Match '"'.
○ Match a character in the set [^"\s] atomically at least once.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent
member.summary: Enumeration for available AddonLifecycle events.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreSetup
member.summary: An event that is fired prior to an addon being setup with its implementation of . This event is useful for modifying the initial data contained within prior to the addon being created.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostSetup
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has finished its initial setup. This event is particularly useful for developers seeking to add custom elements to now-initialized and populated node lists, as well as reading data placed in the AtkValues by the game during the setup process. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreUpdate
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon begins its update cycle via . This event is fired every frame that an addon is loaded, regardless of visibility.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostUpdate
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has finished its update. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreDraw
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon begins drawing to screen via . Unlike , this event is only fired if an addon is visible or otherwise drawing to screen.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostDraw
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has finished its draw to screen. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreFinalize
member.summary: An event that is fired immediately before an addon is finalized via and destroyed. After this event, the addon will destruct its UI node data as well as free any allocated memory. This event can be used for cleanup and tracking tasks.
member.remarks:
This event is NOT fired when the addon is being hidden, but tends to be fired when it's being properly closed.
As this is part of the destruction process for an addon, this event does not have an associated Post event.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreRequestedUpdate
member.summary: An event that is fired before a call to is made in response to a change in the subscribed or backing this addon. This generally occurs in response to receiving data from the game server, but can happen in other cases as well. This event is useful for modifying the data received before it's passed to the UI for display. Contrast to which tends to be in response to client-driven interactions.
member.example: A developer would use this event to intercept free company information after it's received from the server, but before it's displayed to the user. This would allow the developer to add user-driven notes or other information to the Free Company's overview.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostRequestedUpdate
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has finished processing an ArrayData update. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreRefresh
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon calls its method. Refreshes are generally triggered in response to certain user interactions such as changing tabs, and are primarily used to update the AtkValues present in this addon. Contrast to which is called in response to ArrayData updates.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostRefresh
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has finished its refresh. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreReceiveEvent
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon begins processing a user-driven event via , such as mousing over an element or clicking a button. This event is only valid for addons that actually override the ReceiveEvent method of the underlying AtkEventListener.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostReceiveEvent
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon finishes calling its method. See for more information.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreOpen
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon processes its open method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostOpen
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has processed its open method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreClose
member.summary: An even that is fired before an addon processes its Close method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostClose
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has processed its Close method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreShow
member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon processes its Show method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostShow
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has processed its Show method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PreHide

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostHide
member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has processed its Hide method.

member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon processes its OnMove method. OnMove is triggered only when a move is completed.

member.summary: An event that is fired after an addon has processed its OnMove method. OnMove is triggered only when a move is completed.

member.summary: An event that is fired before an addon processes its MouseOver method.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostMouseOver

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Addon.Lifecycle.AddonEvent.PostMouseOut

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.ChatHandlers.CompiledUrlRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
(http|ftp|https)://([\\w_-]+(?:(?:\\.[\\w_-]+)+))([\\w.,@?^=%&:/~+#-]*[\\w@?^=%&/~+#-])?
Options:
RegexOptions.Compiled
Explanation:
○ 1st capture group.
○ Match with 3 alternative expressions.
○ Match the string "http".
○ Match the string "ftp".
○ Match the string "https".
○ Match the string "://".
○ 2nd capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [\-_\w] atomically at least once.
○ Loop greedily at least once.
○ Match '.'.
○ Match a character in the set [\-_\w] greedily at least once.
○ Optional (greedy).
○ 3rd capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [#%&+-/:=?@^~\w] greedily any number of times.
○ Match a character in the set [#%&+\-/=?@^~\w].

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.Conditions.ConditionFlag
member.summary:
Possible state flags (or conditions as they're called internally) that can be set on the local client.
These come from LogMessage (somewhere) and directly map to each state field managed by the client. As of 5.25, it maps to LogMessage row 7700 and onwards, which can be checked by looking at the Condition sheet and looking at what column 2 maps to.
The first 24 conditions are the local players CharacterModes.

Exposed internally for Debug Data window.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadState.ButtonsRaw
member.summary:
Gets raw button bitmask, set the whole time while a button is held. See for the mapping.
Exposed internally for Debug Data window.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadState.ButtonsReleased
member.summary:
Gets button released bitmask, set once right after the button is not hold anymore. See for the mapping.
Exposed internally for Debug Data window.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadState.ButtonsRepeat
member.summary:

Exposed internally for Debug Data window.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.GamePad.GamepadState.NavEnableGamepad
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether detour should block gamepad input for game.
Ideally, we would use (ImGui.GetIO().ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags.NavEnableGamepad) > 0 but this has a race condition during load with the detour which sets up ImGui and throws if our detour gets called before the other.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.JobGauge.Types.DRKGauge.DeliriumComboStep
member.summary:
Gets the step of the Delirium Combo (Scarlet Delirium, Comeuppance, Torcleaver) that the player is on.
Does not in any way consider whether the player is still under Delirium, or if the player still has stacks of Delirium to use.
member.remarks: Value will persist until combo is finished OR if the combo is not completed then the value will stay until about halfway into Delirium's cooldown.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.ClientState.Keys.KeyState
member.summary: Wrapper around the game keystate buffer, which contains the pressed state for all keyboard keys, indexed by virtual vkCode.
member.remarks: The stored key state is actually a combination field, however the below ephemeral states are consumed each frame. Setting the value may be mildly useful, however retrieving the value is largely pointless. In testing, it wasn't possible without setting the statue manually. index & 0 = key pressed. index & 1 = key down (ephemeral). index & 2 = key up (ephemeral). index & 3 = short key press (ephemeral).

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateQuotedParts
member.summary: A part builder for constructing and setting quoted nameplate fields (i.e. free company tag and title).
member.param: The field type which should be set.
Whether this is a Free Company part.
member.remarks: This class works as a lazy writer initialized with empty parts, where an empty part signifies no change should be performed. Only after all handler processing is complete does it write out any parts which were set to the associated field. Reading fields from this class is usually not what you want to do, as you'll only be reading the contents of parts which other plugins have written to. Prefer reading from the base handler's properties or using .

Reading fields from this class is usually not what you want to do, as you'll only be reading the contents of parts which other plugins have written to. member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler
member.summary: A class representing a single nameplate. Provides mechanisms to look up the game object associated with the nameplate and allows for modification of various backing fields in number and string array data, which in turn affect aspects of the nameplate's appearance when drawn. Instances of this class are only valid for a single frame and should not be kept across frames.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.GameObjectId
member.summary: Gets the GameObjectId of the game object associated with this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.GameObject
member.summary: Gets the associated with this nameplate, if possible. Performs an object table scan and caches the result if successful.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.InfoView
member.summary: Gets a read-only view of the nameplate info object data for a nameplate. Modifications to fields do not affect fields in the returned view.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.ArrayIndex
member.summary: Gets the index for this nameplate data in the backing number and string array data. This is not the same as the rendered or object index, which can be retrieved from .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.BattleChara
member.summary: Gets the associated with this nameplate, if possible. Returns null if the nameplate has an associated , but that object cannot be assigned to .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.PlayerCharacter
member.summary: Gets the associated with this nameplate, if possible. Returns null if the nameplate has an associated , but that object cannot be assigned to .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NamePlateInfoAddress
member.summary: Gets the address of the nameplate info struct.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NamePlateObjectAddress
member.summary: Gets the address of the first entry associated with this nameplate in the NamePlate addon's int array.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NamePlateKind
member.summary: Gets a value indicating what kind of nameplate this is, based on the kind of object it is associated with.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.UpdateFlags
member.summary: Gets the update flags for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.TextColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall text color for this nameplate. If this value is changed, the appropriate update flag will be set so that the game will reflect this change immediately.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.EdgeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall text edge color for this nameplate. If this value is changed, the appropriate update flag will be set so that the game will reflect this change immediately.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.MarkerIconId
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon ID for the nameplate's marker icon, which is the large icon used to indicate quest availability and so on. This value is read from and reset by the game every frame, not just when a nameplate changes. Setting this to 0 disables the icon.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NameIconId
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon ID for the nameplate's name icon, which is the small icon shown to the left of the name. Setting this to -1 disables the icon.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NamePlateIndex
member.summary: Gets the nameplate index, which is the index used for rendering and looking up entries in the object array. For number and string array data, is used.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.DrawFlags
member.summary: Gets the draw flags for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.VisibilityFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility flags for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.IsUpdating
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this nameplate is undergoing a major update or not. This is usually true when a nameplate has just appeared or something meaningful about the entity has changed (e.g. its job or status). This flag is reset by the game during the update process (during requested update and before draw).

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.IsPrefixTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the title (when visible) will be displayed above the object's name (a prefix title) instead of below the object's name (a suffix title).

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.DisplayTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the title should be displayed at all.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.NameParts
member.summary: Gets a builder which can be used to help cooperatively build a new name for this nameplate even when other plugins modifying the name are present. Specifically, this builder allows setting text and text-wrapping payloads (e.g. for setting text color) separately.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.TitleParts
member.summary: Gets a builder which can be used to help cooperatively build a new title for this nameplate even when other plugins modifying the title are present. Specifically, this builder allows setting text, text-wrapping payloads (e.g. for setting text color), and opening and closing quote sequences separately.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.FreeCompanyTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the free company tag for this nameplate.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.FreeCompanyTagParts
member.summary: Gets a builder which can be used to help cooperatively build a new FC tag for this nameplate even when other plugins modifying the FC tag are present. Specifically, this builder allows setting text, text-wrapping payloads (e.g. for setting text color), and opening and closing quote sequences separately.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.StatusPrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the status prefix for this nameplate. This prefix is used by the game to add BitmapFontIcon-based online status icons to player nameplates.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.TargetSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the target suffix for this nameplate. This suffix is used by the game to add the squared-letter target tags to the end of combat target nameplates.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.LevelPrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the level prefix for this nameplate. This "Lv60" style prefix is added to enemy and friendly battle NPC nameplates to indicate the NPC level.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.RemoveName
member.summary: Removes the contents of the name field for this nameplate. This differs from simply setting the field to an empty string because it writes a special value to memory, and other setters (except SetField variants) will refuse to overwrite this value. Therefore, fields removed this way are more likely to stay removed.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.INamePlateUpdateHandler.RemoveTitle

This differs from simply setting the field to an empty string because it writes a special value to memory, and other setters (except SetField variants) will refuse to overwrite this value. Therefore, fields removed this way are more likely to stay removed.

member.summary: Sets the string array value for the provided field to a fixed pointer to an empty string in unmanaged memory. Other methods may notice this fixed pointer and refuse to overwrite it, preserving the emptiness of the field.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateUpdateHandler
member.summary: A class representing a single nameplate. Provides mechanisms to look up the game object associated with the nameplate and allows for modification of various backing fields in number and string array data, which in turn affect aspects of the nameplate's appearance when drawn. Instances of this class are only valid for a single frame and should not be kept across frames.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateUpdateHandler.#ctor(Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateUpdateContext,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The index for this nameplate data in the backing number and string array data. This is not the same as the rendered index, which can be retrieved from .

member.summary: Gets or (lazily) creates a part builder container for this nameplate.

member.summary: Resets the state of this handler for re-use in a new update.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateUpdateHandler.WeakSetField(Dalamud.Game.Gui.NamePlate.NamePlateStringField,Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.SeString)
member.summary: Sets the string array value for the provided field, unless it was already set to the special empty string pointer used by the Remove methods.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Network.Internal.MarketBoardUploaders.Universalis.UniversalisMarketBoardUploader.UploadPurchase(Dalamud.Game.Network.Structures.MarketBoardPurchaseHandler,System.UInt64,System.UInt32)
member.remarks: It may seem backwards that an upload only performs a delete request, however this is not trying to track the available listings, that is done via the listings packet. All this does is remove a listing, or delete it, when a purchase has been made.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Network.Internal.WinSockHandlers.NativeFunctions.SetSockOpt(System.IntPtr,System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionLevel,System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32)
member.summary: See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winsock/nf-winsock-setsockopt. The setsockopt function sets a socket option.
member.param: A descriptor that identifies a socket.
The level at which the option is defined (for example, SOL_SOCKET).
The socket option for which the value is to be set (for example, SO_BROADCAST). The optname parameter must be a socket option defined within the specified level, or behavior is undefined.
A pointer to the buffer in which the value for the requested option is specified.
The size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the optval parameter.
member.returns: If no error occurs, setsockopt returns zero. Otherwise, a value of SOCKET_ERROR is returned, and a specific error code can be retrieved by calling WSAGetLastError.

member.summary: Tenacity.
member.remarks: Affects the amount of physical and magic damage dealt and received, as well as HP restored. The higher the value, the more damage dealt, the more HP restored, and the less damage taken. Only applicable when role is Tank.

member.summary: Attack Power.
member.remarks: Affects amount of damage dealt by physical attacks. The higher the value, the more damage dealt.

member.summary: Defense.
member.remarks: Affects the amount of damage taken by physical attacks. The higher the value, the less damage taken.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Player.PlayerAttribute.DirectHitRate
member.summary: Direct Hit Rate.
member.remarks: Affects the rate at which your physical and magic attacks land direct hits, dealing slightly more damage than normal hits. The higher the value, the higher the frequency with which your hits will be direct. Higher values will also result in greater damage for actions which guarantee direct hits.

member.summary: Scan for a .data address using a .text function. This is intended to be used with IDA sigs. Place your cursor on the line calling a static address, and create and IDA sig. The signature and offset should not break through instruction boundaries.

The offset from function start of the instruction using the data.
member.returns: An IntPtr to the static memory location.

member.param: The signature of the function using the data.

The offset from function start of the instruction using the data.
member.returns: true if the signature was found.

member.summary: The row id within the sheet to process.

member.summary: The quantity of the entity (default is 1). Used to determine grammatical number (e.g., singular or plural).

member.summary: The article type.

Depending on the , this has different meanings.
See , , , .

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Text.Noun.NounParams.GrammaticalCase
member.summary: The grammatical case (e.g., Nominative, Genitive, Dative, Accusative) used for German texts (default is 0).

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Text.Noun.NounParams.LinkMarker
member.summary: An optional string that is placed in front of the text that should be linked, such as item names (default is an empty string; the game uses "//").

member.name: F:Dalamud.Game.Text.Noun.NounParams.IsActionSheet
member.summary: An indicator that this noun will be processed from an Action sheet. Only used for German texts.

member.summary: Gets the column offset.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload
member.summary: This class represents a parsed SeString payload.
Parsing helpers.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of this payload.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.Dirty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether whether this payload has been modified since the last Encode().

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.Decode(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Decodes a binary representation of a payload into its corresponding nice object payload.
member.param: A reader positioned at the start of the payload, and containing at least one entire payload.
member.returns: The constructed Payload-derived object that was decoded from the binary data.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.Encode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encode this payload object into a byte[] useable in-game for things like the chat log.
member.param: If true, ignores any cached value and forcibly reencodes the payload from its internal representation.
member.returns: A byte[] suitable for use with in-game handlers such as the chat log.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.EncodeImpl
member.summary: Encodes the internal state of this payload into a byte[] suitable for sending to in-game handlers such as the chat log.
member.returns: Encoded binary payload data suitable for use with in-game handlers.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Game.Text.SeStringHandling.Payload.DecodeImpl(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int64)
member.summary: Decodes a byte stream from the game into a payload object.
member.param: A BinaryReader containing at least all the data for this payload.
The location holding the end of the data for this payload.

member.summary: The start byte of a payload.

member.summary: The end byte of a payload.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Hooking.AsmHook
member.summary: Manages a hook which can be used to intercept a call to native function. This class is basically a thin wrapper around the LocalHook type to provide helper functions.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This is an assembly hook and should not be used for except under unique circumstances. Hook is not activated until Enable() method is called.
member.param: A memory address to install a hook.
The name of what you are hooking, since a delegate is not required.
How the hook is inserted into the execution flow.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.AsmHook.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.String[],System.String,Dalamud.Hooking.AsmHookBehaviour)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This is an assembly hook and should not be used for except under unique circumstances. Hook is not activated until Enable() method is called.
member.param: A memory address to install a hook.
FASM syntax assembly code representing your hook. The first line should be use64.
The name of what you are hooking, since a delegate is not required.
How the hook is inserted into the execution flow.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker
member.summary: A class which stores a copy of the bytes at a location which will be hooked in the future, such that those bytes can be restored later to "unhook" the function.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Upon creation, the Unhooker stores a copy of the bytes stored at the provided address, and can be used to restore these bytes when the hook should be removed. As such this class should be instantiated before the function is actually hooked.
member.param: The address which will be hooked.
The minimum amount of bytes to restore when unhooking.
The maximum amount of bytes to restore when unhooking.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.TrimAfterHook
member.summary: When called after a hook is created, checks the pre-hook original bytes and post-hook modified bytes, trimming the original bytes stored and removing unmodified bytes from the end of the byte sequence. Assuming no concurrent actions modified the same address space, this should result in storing only the minimum bytes required to unhook the function.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Hooking.Internal.Unhooker.Unhook
member.summary: Attempts to unhook the function by replacing the hooked bytes with the original bytes. If was called, the trimmed original bytes stored at that time will be used for unhooking. Otherwise, a naive algorithm which only restores bytes until the first unchanged byte will be used in order to avoid overwriting adjacent data.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager
member.summary: Implements interop enums and function calls to interact with external drag and drop.
A manager that keeps state of external windows drag and drop events, and can be used to create ImGui drag and drop sources and targets for those external events.
Implements the IDropTarget interface to interact with external drag and dropping.

member.summary: Enable external drag and drop.

member.summary: Disable external drag and drop.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.formatEtc
member.summary: Create the drag and drop formats we accept.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.DragEnter(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.POINTL,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag and drop process drags files into any FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.DragOver(System.UInt32,Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.POINTL,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Invoked every windows update-frame as long as the drag and drop process keeps hovering over an FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.
member.remarks: Can be invoked more often than once a XIV frame, so we are keeping track of frames to skip unnecessary updates.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.DragLeave
member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag and drop process that hovered over any FFXIV-related viewport leaves all FFXIV-related viewports.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.Drop(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject,System.UInt32,Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.DragDropManager.POINTL,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Invoked whenever a drag process ends by dropping over any FFXIV-related viewport.
member.param: The mouse button used to drag as well as key modifiers.
Effects that can be used with this drag and drop process.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager
member.summary: A service to handle external drag and drop from WinAPI.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.ServiceAvailable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Drag and Drop functionality is available at all.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.IsDragging
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether anything is being dragged from an external application and over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Files
member.summary: Gets the list of files currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Extensions
member.summary: Gets the set of file types by extension currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.Directories
member.summary: Gets the list of directories currently being dragged from an external application over any of the games viewports.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiSource(System.String,System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop source that is active only if anything is being dragged from an external source.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
A function returning whether the current status is relevant for this source. Checked before creating the source but only if something is being dragged.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiSource(System.String,System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean},System.Func{Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop source that is active only if anything is being dragged from an external source.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
A function returning whether the current status is relevant for this source. Checked before creating the source but only if something is being dragged.

Executes ImGui functions to build a tooltip. Should return true if it creates any tooltip and false otherwise. If multiple sources are active, only the first non-empty tooltip type drawn in a frame will be used.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.DragDrop.IDragDropManager.CreateImGuiTarget(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String}@,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String}@)
member.summary: Create an ImGui drag and drop target on the last ImGui object.
member.param: The label used for the drag and drop payload.
On success, contains the list of file paths dropped onto the target.
On success, contains the list of directory paths dropped onto the target.
member.returns: True if items were dropped onto the target this frame, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.HardExpiry
member.summary: Gets or sets the hard expiry.
member.remarks:
Setting this value will override and , in that the notification will be dismissed when this expiry expires.
Set to to make only take effect.
If both and are MaxValue, then the notification will not expire after a set time. It must be explicitly dismissed by the user or via calling .
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.InitialDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial duration.
member.remarks: Set to to make only take effect.
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer, but the remaining duration will still be calculated based on .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.INotification.ExtensionDurationSinceLastInterest
member.summary: Gets or sets the new duration for this notification once the mouse cursor leaves the window and the window is no longer focused.
member.remarks:
If set to or less, then this feature is turned off, and hovering the mouse on the notification or focusing on it will not make the notification stay.
Updating this value will reset the dismiss timer.

On plugin unloads, the icon may be reverted back to the default, if the instance of is not provided by Dalamud.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiNotification.Internal.ActiveNotification.RemoveNonDalamudInvocations
member.summary: Removes non-Dalamud invocation targets from events.
member.remarks: This is done to prevent references of plugins being unloaded from outliving the plugin itself. Anything that can contain plugin-provided types and functions count, which effectively means that events and interface/object-typed fields need to be scrubbed. As a notification can be marked as non-user-dismissable, in which case after removing event handlers there will be no way to remove the notification, we force the notification to become user-dismissable, and reset the expiry to the default duration on unload.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.Internal.TextProcessing.UnicodeLineBreakClass.OP

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.SeStringDrawParams.TargetDrawList
member.summary: Gets or sets the target draw list.
member.value: Target draw list, default(ImDrawListPtr) to not draw, or null to use (the default).
member.remarks: If this value is set, will not be called, and ImGui ID will be ignored. You must specify a valid draw list, a valid font via and if you set this value, since the renderer will not be able to retrieve them from ImGui context. Must be set when drawing off the main thread.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.SeStringDrawParams.GetEntity
member.summary: Gets or sets the function to be called on every codepoint and payload for the purpose of offering chances to draw something else instead of glyphs or SeString payload entities.

member.summary: Gets or sets the screen offset of the left top corner.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.SeStringDrawParams.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font to use.
member.value: Font to use, or null to use (the default).
member.remarks: Must be set when specifying a target draw-list or drawing off the main thread.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.SeStringDrawParams.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ImGuiSeStringRenderer.SeStringDrawParams.LineHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the line height ratio.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.Internal.ImGuiClipboardFunctionProvider
member.summary: Configures the ImGui clipboard behaviour to work nicely with XIV.

remarks.para: XIV uses '\r' for line endings and will truncate all text after a '\n' character. This means that copy/pasting multi-line text from ImGui to XIV will only copy the first line.
ImGui uses '\n' for line endings and will ignore '\r' entirely. This means that copy/pasting multi-line text from XIV to ImGui will copy all the text without line breaks.
To fix this we normalize all clipboard line endings entering/exiting ImGui to '\r\n' which works for both ImGui and XIV.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.Internal.InterfaceManager.ResizeBuffersDelegate
member.summary:
Detour function for .
Microsoft Learn.
member.param: The number of buffers in the swap chain (including all back and front buffers). This number can be different from the number of buffers with which you created the swap chain. This number can't be greater than . Set this number to zero to preserve the existing number of buffers in the swap chain. You can't specify less than two buffers for the flip presentation model.

The new width of the back buffer. If you specify zero, DXGI will use the width of the client area of the target window. You can't specify the width as zero if you called the method to create the swap chain for a composition surface.

The new height of the back buffer. If you specify zero, DXGI will use the height of the client area of the target window. You can't specify the height as zero if you called the method to create the swap chain for a composition surface.

A DXGI_FORMAT-typed value for the new format of the back buffer. Set this value to to preserve the existing format of the back buffer. The flip presentation model supports a more restricted set of formats than the bit-block transfer (bitblt) model.
A combination of -typed values that are combined by using a bitwise OR operation. The resulting value specifies options for swap-chain behavior.
member.returns: A representing the result of the operation.

Called before calling .
Expect to be passed.
When called from , this will be called before the delegates passed to .

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontAtlasBuildStep.PostBuild
member.summary:
Called after calling .
Expect to be passed.
When called from , this will be called after the delegates passed to ; you can do cross-font operations here.
This callback is not guaranteed to happen after , but it will never happen on its own.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies how should global font scale affect a font.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.Default
member.summary: Do the default handling. Dalamud will load the sufficienty large font that will accomodate the global scale, and stretch the loaded glyphs so that they look pixel-perfect after applying global scale on drawing. Note that bitmap fonts and game fonts will always look blurry if they're not in their original sizes.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.SkipHandling
member.summary: Do nothing with the font. Dalamud will load the font with the size that is exactly as specified. On drawing, the font will look blurry due to stretching. Intended for use with custom scale handling.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.FontScaleMode.UndoGlobalScale
member.summary: Stretch the glyphs of the loaded font by the inverse of the global scale. On drawing, the font will always render exactly as the requested size without blurring, as long as and do not affect the scale any further. Note that bitmap fonts and game fonts will always look blurry if they're not in their original sizes.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.IFontAtlas
member.summary:
Wrapper for .
Not intended for plugins to implement.

member.summary:
Event to be called on build step changes.
is meaningless for this event.

member.name: E:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.IFontAtlas.RebuildRecommend
member.summary:
Event fired when a font rebuild operation is recommended.
This event will be invoked from the main thread.
Reasons for the event include changes in and initialization of new associated font handles.
member.remarks:
You should call or if is not set to true.
Avoid calling here; it will block the main thread.

member.summary: The raw config.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct, copying applicable values from an existing instance of .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.FontNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of font within a TTF/OTF file.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.SizePx
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired size of the new font, in pixels.
Effectively, this is the line height.
Value is tied with .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.SizePt
member.summary:
Gets or sets the desired size of the new font, in points.
Effectively, this is the line height.
Value is tied with .

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.OversampleH
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal oversampling pixel count.
Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning.
Note the difference between 2 and 3 is minimal so you can reduce this to 2 to save memory.
Read https://github.com/nothings/stb/blob/master/tests/oversample/README.md for details.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.OversampleV
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical oversampling pixel count.
Rasterize at higher quality for sub-pixel positioning.
This is not really useful as we don't use sub-pixel positions on the Y axis.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.PixelSnapH
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to align every glyph to pixel boundary.
Useful e.g. if you are merging a non-pixel aligned font with the default font.
If enabled, you can set and to 1.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphExtraSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the extra spacing (in pixels) between glyphs.
Only X axis is supported for now.
Effectively, it is the letter spacing.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the offset all glyphs from this font input.
Use this to offset fonts vertically when merging multiple fonts.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphRanges
member.summary:
Gets or sets the glyph ranges, which is a user-provided list of Unicode range. Each range has 2 values, and values are inclusive.
The list must be zero-terminated.
If empty or null, then all the glyphs from the font that is in the range of UCS-2 will be added.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphMinAdvanceX
member.summary:
Gets or sets the minimum AdvanceX for glyphs.
Set only to align font icons.
Set both / to enforce mono-space font.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.GlyphMaxAdvanceX
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum AdvanceX for glyphs.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.RasterizerMultiply
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that either brightens (>1.0f) or darkens (<1.0f) the font output.
Brightening small fonts may be a good workaround to make them more readable.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.RasterizerGamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the gamma value for fonts.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.EllipsisChar
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value explicitly specifying unicode codepoint of the ellipsis character.
When fonts are being merged first specified ellipsis will be used.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired name of the new font. Names longer than 40 bytes will be partially lost.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.ManagedFontAtlas.SafeFontConfig.MergeFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired font to merge with, if set.

member.summary: Throws with appropriate messages, if this has invalid values.

member.returns: An instance of that is guaranteed to be available for the current frame being drawn.

remarks.para: Do not cache the result of this function across draw calls for different frames. s may be cached, but the performance benefit will be minimal.
Calling outside the main thread will fail.
This function does not throw.
will be ignored, including the cases when the returned texture wrap is passed to a function with leaveWrapOpen parameter.
If the texture is unavailable for any reason, then the returned instance of will point to an empty texture instead.

will be ignored, including the cases when the returned texture wrap is passed to a function with leaveWrapOpen parameter.

summary.para: Creates a new instance of holding a new reference to this texture. The returned texture is guaranteed to be available until is called.

WARNING! Usually, this method should be a "last resort"/compatibility wrapper for old code that does not directly support directly. Prefer using any of the other methods if possible, and DO NOT CACHE the resulting texture wrap from those functions.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Textures.TextureWraps.IDalamudTextureWrap.CreateWrapSharingLowLevelResource
member.summary: Creates a new reference to the resource being pointed by this instance of .
member.returns: The new reference to this texture wrap.
member.remarks:
On calling this function, a new instance of will be returned, but with the same . The new instance must be d, as the backing resource will stay alive until all the references are released. The old instance may be disposed as needed, once this function returns; the new instance will stay alive regardless of whether the old instance has been disposed.
Primary purpose of this function is to share textures across plugin boundaries. When texture wraps get passed across plugin boundaries for use for an indeterminate duration, the receiver should call this function to obtain a new reference to the texture received, so that it gets its own "copy" of the texture and the caller may dispose the texture anytime without any care for the receiver.
The default implementation will treat as an .

fontAtlas.NewDelegateFontHandle( e => e.OnPreBuild( tk => tk.AddDalamudDefaultFont(UiBuilder.DefaultFontSizePx)));

member.name: P:Dalamud.Interface.Windowing.Window.TitleBarButtons
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of available title bar buttons.
If or are set to true, and this features is not disabled globally by the user, an internal title bar button to manage these is added when drawing, but it will not appear in this collection. If you wish to remove this button, set both of these values to false.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Windowing.Window.DrawConditions
member.summary: Additional conditions for the window to be drawn, regardless of its open-state.
member.returns: True if the window should be drawn, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Not being drawn due to failing this condition will not change focus or trigger OnClose. This is checked before PreDraw, but after Update.

member.summary: Code to be executed before conditionals are applied and the window is drawn.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Interface.Windowing.Window.Draw
member.summary: Code to be executed every time the window renders.
member.remarks: In this method, implement your drawing code. You do NOT need to ImGui.Begin your window.

member.name: M:Dalamud.IoC.Internal.ServiceContainer.GetScope
member.summary: Get a service scope, enabling the creation of objects with scoped services.
member.returns: An implementation of a service scope.

member.name: M:Dalamud.IoC.Internal.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.Type,Dalamud.IoC.Internal.ServiceScopeImpl,System.Object[])
member.summary: Resolves and returns an instance of the specified service type, using either singleton or scoped lifetime as appropriate.
member.param: The type of the service to resolve. This must be a concrete or interface type registered with the service manager.
The scope within which to create scoped services. Required if the requested service type is registered as scoped; otherwise, can be null.
An array of objects available for scoped resolution. Used to locate or create scoped service instances when applicable.
member.returns: An instance of the requested service type. Returns a singleton instance if available, a scoped instance if required, or an object from the provided scoped objects if it matches the service type.
member.exception: Thrown if a scoped service is requested but no scope is provided, or if the requested service type cannot be resolved from the scoped objects.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection
member.summary: PAGE_* from memoryapi.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.Execute
member.summary: Enables execute access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteRead
member.summary: Enables execute or read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteReadWrite
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or read/write access to the committed region of pages.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ExecuteWriteCopy
member.summary: Enables execute, read-only, or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE, and the change is written to the new page. This flag is not supported by the VirtualAlloc or VirtualAllocEx functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.NoAccess
member.summary: Disables all access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to read from, write to, or execute the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ReadOnly
member.summary: Enables read-only access to the committed region of pages. An attempt to write to the committed region results in an access violation. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, an attempt to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.ReadWrite
member.summary: Enables read-only or read/write access to the committed region of pages. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.WriteCopy
member.summary: Enables read-only or copy-on-write access to a mapped view of a file mapping object. An attempt to write to a committed copy-on-write page results in a private copy of the page being made for the process. The private page is marked as PAGE_READWRITE, and the change is written to the new page. If Data Execution Prevention is enabled, attempting to execute code in the committed region results in an access violation. This flag is not supported by the VirtualAlloc or VirtualAllocEx functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.TargetsInvalid
member.summary: Sets all locations in the pages as invalid targets for CFG. Used along with any execute page protection like PAGE_EXECUTE, PAGE_EXECUTE_READ, PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE and PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY. Any indirect call to locations in those pages will fail CFG checks and the process will be terminated. The default behavior for executable pages allocated is to be marked valid call targets for CFG. This flag is not supported by the VirtualProtect or CreateFileMapping functions.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.TargetsNoUpdate
member.summary: Pages in the region will not have their CFG information updated while the protection changes for VirtualProtect. For example, if the pages in the region was allocated using PAGE_TARGETS_INVALID, then the invalid information will be maintained while the page protection changes. This flag is only valid when the protection changes to an executable type like PAGE_EXECUTE, PAGE_EXECUTE_READ, PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE and PAGE_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY. The default behavior for VirtualProtect protection change to executable is to mark all locations as valid call targets for CFG.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.Guard
member.summary: Pages in the region become guard pages. Any attempt to access a guard page causes the system to raise a STATUS_GUARD_PAGE_VIOLATION exception and turn off the guard page status. Guard pages thus act as a one-time access alarm. For more information, see Creating Guard Pages. When an access attempt leads the system to turn off guard page status, the underlying page protection takes over. If a guard page exception occurs during a system service, the service typically returns a failure status indicator. This value cannot be used with PAGE_NOACCESS. This flag is not supported by the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.NoCache
member.summary: Sets all pages to be non-cachable. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped with SEC_NOCACHE can result in an EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION exception. The PAGE_NOCACHE flag cannot be used with the PAGE_GUARD, PAGE_NOACCESS, or PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flags. The PAGE_NOCACHE flag can be used only when allocating private memory with the VirtualAlloc, VirtualAllocEx, or VirtualAllocExNuma functions. To enable non-cached memory access for shared memory, specify the SEC_NOCACHE flag when calling the CreateFileMapping function.

member.name: F:Dalamud.Memory.MemoryProtection.WriteCombine
member.summary: Sets all pages to be write-combined. Applications should not use this attribute except when explicitly required for a device. Using the interlocked functions with memory that is mapped as write-combined can result in an EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION exception. The PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flag cannot be specified with the PAGE_NOACCESS, PAGE_GUARD, and PAGE_NOCACHE flags. The PAGE_WRITECOMBINE flag can be used only when allocating private memory with the VirtualAlloc, VirtualAllocEx, or VirtualAllocExNuma functions. To enable write-combined memory access for shared memory, specify the SEC_WRITECOMBINE flag when calling the CreateFileMapping function.

member.summary: Set the file path to the main assembly for the context. This is used as the starting point for loading other assemblies. The directory that contains it is also known as the 'app local' directory.
member.param: The file path. Must not be null or empty. Must be an absolute path.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.AssemblyLoadContextBuilder.SetDefaultContext(System.Runtime.Loader.AssemblyLoadContext)
member.summary: Replaces the default used by the . Use this feature if the of the is not the Runtime's default load context. i.e. (AssemblyLoadContext.GetLoadContext(Assembly.GetExecutingAssembly) != .

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.AssemblyLoadContextBuilder.PreferLoadContextAssembly(System.Reflection.AssemblyName)
member.summary:
Instructs the load context to prefer a private version of this assembly, even if that version is different from the version used by the host application. Use this when you do not need to exchange types created from within the load context with other contexts or the default app context.
This may mean the types loaded from this assembly will not match the types from an assembly with the same name, but different version, in the host application.
For example, if the host application has a type named Foo from assembly Banana, Version=1.0.0.0 and the load context prefers a private version of Banan, Version=2.0.0.0, when comparing two objects, one created by the host (Foo1) and one created from within the load context (Foo2), they will not have the same type. Foo1.GetType() != Foo2.GetType().

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.AssemblyLoadContextBuilder.PreferDefaultLoadContextAssembly(System.Reflection.AssemblyName,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Instructs the load context to first attempt to load assemblies by this name from the default app context, even if other assemblies in this load context express a dependency on a higher or lower version. Use this when you need to exchange types created from within the load context with other contexts or the default app context.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.AssemblyLoadContextBuilder.PreferDefaultLoadContext(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Instructs the load context to first search for binaries from the default app context, even if other assemblies in this load context express a dependency on a higher or lower version. Use this when you need to exchange types created from within the load context with other contexts or the default app context.
This may mean the types loaded from within the context are force-downgraded to the version provided by the host. can be used to selectively identify binaries which should not be loaded from the default load context.
member.param: When true, first attemp to load binaries from the default load context.

member.summary: Represents a managed, .NET assembly.

member.summary: Gets the name of the managed library.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.ManagedLibrary.AdditionalProbingPath
member.summary:
Gets the path to file within an additional probing path root. This is typically a combination of the NuGet package ID (lowercased), version, and path within the package.
For example, microsoft.data.sqlite/1.0.0/lib/netstandard1.3/Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.dll.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.ManagedLibrary.AppLocalPath
member.summary:
Gets the path to file within a deployed, framework-dependent application.
For most managed libraries, this will be the file name. For example, MyPlugin1.dll.
For runtime-specific managed implementations, this may include a sub folder path. For example, runtimes/win/lib/netcoreapp2.0/System.Diagnostics.EventLog.dll.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.ManagedLibrary.CreateFromPackage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of from a NuGet package.
member.param: The path within the NuGet package.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.NativeLibrary
member.summary: Represents an unmanaged library, such as `libsqlite3`, which may need to be loaded for P/Invoke to work.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.NativeLibrary.Name
member.summary:
Gets the name of the native library. This should match the name of the P/Invoke call.
For example, if specifying `[DllImport("sqlite3")]`, should be sqlite3. This may not match the exact file name as loading will attempt variations on the name according to OS convention. On Windows, P/Invoke will attempt to load `sqlite3.dll`. On macOS, it will attempt to find `sqlite3.dylib` and `libsqlite3.dylib`. On Linux, it will attempt to find `sqlite3.so` and `libsqlite3.so`.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.NativeLibrary.AppLocalPath
member.summary:
Gets the path to file within a deployed, framework-dependent application.
For example, runtimes/linux-x64/native/libsqlite.so.

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.NativeLibrary.AdditionalProbingPath
member.summary:
Gets the path to file within an additional probing path root. This is typically a combination of the NuGet package ID (lowercased), version, and path within the package.
For example, sqlite/3.13.3/runtimes/linux-x64/native/libsqlite.so.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.LibraryModel.NativeLibrary.CreateFromPackage(System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.name: T:Dalamud.Plugin.Internal.Loader.PluginLoader
member.summary:
This loader attempts to load binaries for execution (both managed assemblies and native libraries) in the same way that .NET Core would if they were originally part of the .NET Core application.
This loader reads configuration files produced by .NET Core (.deps.json and runtimeconfig.json) as well as a custom file (*.config files). These files describe a list of .dlls and a set of dependencies. The loader searches the plugin path, as well as any additionally specified paths, for binaries which satisfy the plugin's requirements.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.RegisterAction(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Registers a for use by other plugins via RPC. This Delegate must satisfy the constraints of an type as defined by the interface, meaning they may not return a value and must have the proper number of parameters.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.RegisterFunc(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Registers a for use by other plugins via RPC. This Delegate must satisfy the constraints of a type as defined by the interface, meaning its return type and parameters must match accordingly.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.Subscribe(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Registers a (of type ) that will be called when the providing plugin calls . This method can be used to receive notifications of events or data updates from a specific plugin.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.Unsubscribe(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Removes a subscription created through . Note that the to be unsubscribed must be the same instance as the one passed in.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.InvokeAction(System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the Action registered for this IPC call gate via . This method is intended to be called by plugins wishing to access another plugin via RPC. The parameters passed to this method will be passed to the owning plugin, with appropriate serialization for complex data types. Primitive data types will be passed as-is. The target Action will be called on the same thread as the caller.
member.exception: This is thrown when the IPC publisher has not registered an action for calling yet.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.InvokeFunc``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the Function registered for this IPC call gate via . This method is intended to be called by plugins wishing to access another plugin via RPC. The parameters passed to this method will be passed to the owning plugin, with appropriate serialization for complex data types. Primitive data types will be passed as-is. The target Action will be called on the same thread as the caller.
member.exception: This is thrown when the IPC publisher has not registered a func for calling yet.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Ipc.Internal.CallGatePubSubBase.SendMessage(System.Object[])
member.summary: Send the given arguments to all subscribers (through ) of this IPC call gate. This method is intended to be used by the provider plugin to notify all subscribers of an event or data update. The parameters passed to this method will be passed to all subscribers, with appropriate serialization for complex data types. Primitive data types will be passed as-is. The subscription actions will be called sequentially in order of registration on the same thread as the caller.

member.exception: Thrown when an entry with the specified title exists.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IDtrBar.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a DTR bar entry from the system.

member.remarks: Remove operation is not guaranteed to be immediately effective. Calls to may result in an entry marked to be remove being revived and used again.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IFramework
member.summary: This class represents the Framework of the native game client and grants access to various subsystems.

ul.li: If you do need to do use await and have your task keep executing on the main thread after waiting is done, use Run.
If you need to call or , use RunOnFrameworkThread. It also skips the task scheduler if invoked already from the framework thread.

remarks.para: The game is likely to completely lock up if you call above synchronous function and getter, because starting a new task by default runs on , which would make the task run on the framework thread if invoked via Run. This includes Task.Factory.StartNew and Task.ContinueWith. Use Task.Run if you need to start a new task from the callback specified to Run, as it will force your task to be run in the default thread pool.
See to see the difference in behaviors, and how would a misuse of these functions result in a deadlock.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IFramework.DelayTicks(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns a task that completes after the given number of ticks.
member.returns: A new that gets resolved after specified number of ticks happen.
member.remarks: The continuation will run on the framework thread by default.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IFramework.Run(System.Action,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Run given function right away if this function has been called from game's Framework.Update thread, or otherwise run on next Framework.Update call.
member.returns: Task representing the pending or already completed function.

remarks.para: Starting new tasks and waiting on them synchronously from this callback will completely lock up the game. Use await if you need to wait on something from an async callback.
See the remarks on if you need to choose which one to use, between Run and RunOnFrameworkThread. Note that RunOnTick is a fancy version of RunOnFrameworkThread.

member.summary: Run given function right away if this function has been called from game's Framework.Update thread, or otherwise run on next Framework.Update call.
member.returns: Task representing the pending or already completed function.

remarks.para: Starting new tasks and waiting on them synchronously from this callback will completely lock up the game. Use await if you need to wait on something from an async callback.
See the remarks on if you need to choose which one to use, between Run and RunOnFrameworkThread. Note that RunOnTick is a fancy version of RunOnFrameworkThread.

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IFramework.RunOnFrameworkThread``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Run given function right away if this function has been called from game's Framework.Update thread, or otherwise run on next Framework.Update call.
member.returns: Task representing the pending or already completed function.

remarks.para: await, Task.Factory.StartNew or alike will continue off the framework thread.

Awaiting on the returned from RunOnFrameworkThread, Run, or RunOnTick right away inside the callback specified to this function has a chance of locking up the game. Do not do await framework.RunOnFrameworkThread(...); directly or indirectly from the delegate passed to this function.
See the remarks on if you need to choose which one to use, between Run and RunOnFrameworkThread. Note that RunOnTick is a fancy version of RunOnFrameworkThread.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IGameConfig
member.summary: This class represents the game's configuration.
member.remarks:
Accessing -typed properties such as , directly or indirectly via , , or alike will block, if the game is not done loading.
Therefore, avoid accessing configuration from your plugin constructor, especially if your plugin sets to 2 and to true. If property access from the plugin constructor is desired, do the value retrieval asynchronously via ; do not wait for the result right away.

member.summary:
Event that is fired when the inventory has been changed, without trying to interpret two inventory slot changes as a move event as appropriate.

Event that is fired when an item is added to an inventory.

Use if you do not want such reinterpretation.

member.name: T:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IKeyState
member.summary: Wrapper around the game keystate buffer, which contains the pressed state for all keyboard keys, indexed by virtual vkCode.
member.remarks: The stored key state is actually a combination field, however the below ephemeral states are consumed each frame. Setting the value may be mildly useful, however retrieving the value is largely pointless. In testing, it wasn't possible without setting the statue manually. index & 0 = key pressed. index & 1 = key down (ephemeral). index & 2 = key up (ephemeral). index & 3 = short key press (ephemeral).

member.name: P:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.IKeyState.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get or set the key-pressed state for a given vkCode.
member.returns: Whether the specified key is currently pressed.
member.exception: If the vkCode is not valid. Refer to or .
If the set value is non-zero.

member.summary: Gets the value in the index array.
member.returns: The raw value stored in the index array.
member.exception: If the vkCode is not valid. Refer to or .

member.summary: Sets the value in the index array.
member.param: The raw value to set in the index array.
member.exception: If the vkCode is not valid. Refer to or .
If the set value is non-zero.

member.summary: An event which fires after nameplate data is updated and at least one nameplate had important updates. The subscriber is provided with a list of handlers for nameplates with important updates.
member.remarks: Fires before .

member.name: E:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.INamePlateGui.OnDataUpdate
member.summary: An event which fires when nameplate data is updated. The subscriber is provided with a list of handlers for all nameplates.
member.remarks: This event is likely to fire every frame even when no nameplates are actually updated, so in most cases is preferred. Fires before .

member.name: E:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.INamePlateGui.OnPostDataUpdate
member.summary: An event which fires after nameplate data is updated. The subscriber is provided with a list of handlers for all nameplates.
member.remarks: This event is likely to fire every frame even when no nameplates are actually updated, so in most cases is preferred. Fires after .

member.name: M:Dalamud.Plugin.Services.INamePlateGui.RequestRedraw
member.summary: Requests that all nameplates should be redrawn on the following frame.
member.remarks: This causes extra work for the game, and should not need to be called every frame. However, it is acceptable to call frequently when needed (e.g. in response to a manual settings change by the user) or when necessary (e.g. after a change of zone, party type, etc.).
